38976112.review:
I would totally recommend this game!
-Fun meter: 10/10
-Price: Totally worth it! (you should buy it whilst it's on discount though)
-Great to play with friends.
-Servers: This game needs a lot more people because it's so unpopular, though it's so fun. 
-The game is only in early access but is still the funniest early access game i've ever played.
-Sometimes there can be bugs, like getting stuck into a wall (during pvp that's horrible) but that's rare to happen.
-Customizing your own character: you can choose amongst colours and helmets to make your own Zero G arena suit! You get the different helmets by completing different achievements!
-Guns: there are 6 different guns, a railgun, a missile launcher, a machine gun, a homing missile gun, a ball launcher and shotgun!
-Gamemodes: Team deathmatch, King of the hill, Free for all.
-Controls: Don't worry, you can change them on the menu. They are very important for the game.
-Maps: there are about 6 different maps i think.
Summary: I love it, the funniest FPS you can find, you are someone on a space suit with no control over body parts, you have a hook and gravity boots to help you maneuver through the arena, you can choose wheter to stay on ground with more accuracy but less defence, or to fly like a ragdoll, with less accuracy and more agility. You have to defend yourself with guns you find thoughout the map.
The only problem really is the number of people! Please join the fun!

There are some minor visual issues and things regarding curving around 3 dimensional magnetic floors and how it affects your view (like traveling from 1 face of a cube to another will curve everything making combat while walking around it clunky, it will change your crosshair placement). Some magnetic surfaces have issues activating correctly too , usually when there are many in close proximity. Besides that the skeleton for a very fun arena shooter is here but like i said, noone plays this for whatever reason. At this point I would even reccomend making it free for a period of time or giving out copies to popular youtubers etc to see if there will be a spike in the playerbase. 34373979.review:
This game is amazing!

I'll admit, the price is a little high right now considering there are no active servers most of the time, but I'll get to that later.
I love the concept, and with regular updates I find it pretty exciting to see what has been added and watching this game progress over time. It has always been insane fun though, and it seems like the perfect game minus some things like the title screen (which I hope will be improved in the future) that just make it seem a little less... professional I guess?

But the main problem has come up in a lot of reviews so I'm sure you're already aware... almost no one plays it.

When I say almost, what I mean is this; when I try to find a server, there are almost always none. However, there are ways around this. The obvious one is just to play it with a friend; that way there is an active server and people are very likely to join. Sometimes I just make a server and sit in it, maybe go on my phone or whatever, and, at certain times of the day, at least someone will join. This seems like an annoying thing to do, I know, but I still love the game nonetheless.

I hope this was helpful, I wouldn't recommend it if you don't have any friends who have the game, but if you do this is one of the most fun games for the price!

(although PS I think the price should be lower or free just until it has enough regular players :).)

29635147.review: This game is awesome! This is a very creative shooter and it's done very well. I think that the transition from zero g to grounded could use a small bit of work (It's weird seeing the characters go from ragdoll to stiff instantly) but I know that can be difficult. Something else that would could be a good change is that when you're in zero g, there should be no limit on how far up or down you can look, as there is no up or down in zero gravity. One more thing that would improve the game slightly would be a grabbing mechanic. Something such as pressing E for right hand and Q for left hand when in zero gravity and you can grab onto corners and edges and things such as that. The one level called "Chamber" has that area with no magnetic surfaces and I think it'd be cool to be able to grab onto the objects in there. I'm still very exited to see where this game goes in the future. Plenty of potential! And even though I got the game while it was free, I would definetly say that this would be worth the 3 dollars.

28879583.review:
I will preface this review by saying that I put the most importance on gameplay when judging a game and that items such as graphics and general interfaces are secondary critiques. If a game is good, I will enjoy it no matter how it may look.

This game has a free demo on the internet, but it was so good that I decided to buy the full game. Simply put, this game has some of the most innovative and fun gameplay mechanics in a third-person shooter that I've seen in a long time. The controls are easy to pick up, and the movement capabilities of the in-game avatar seem limitless. The ability to toggle the gravity boots on and off allow for grounded gameplay or zero gravity mayhem. This, coupled with the beam that allows the player to grapple around the map, allows for immensely satisfying and exciting gameplay. I've only played for a short while in the full game, but it is so incredibly amazing how much fun I've gotten out of the gameplay.

Now of course this title is still in Early Access, and as such there are a few issues. The problem that sticks out the most is the lack of a stable player base at the moment. If you have friends or are on during peak hours, finding a game is simple, but the lack of AI in the current build of the game means that you're out of luck playing solo unless you're content practicing your movement, which I must say is still a ton of fun to do even by yourself. 

The graphics are pretty decent, but the graphical interface needs some work. I fully expect the graphical interface to be ironed out, and the game definitely looks good for what it is. The particle effects are nice and the lighting is definitely good-looking. Just look at the screenshots and videos above for an idea of what to expect. Overall, the game has a distinct lack of visual polish, but that is to be expected of a game in the early stages of development. 

I have not experienced any major glitches or hang-ups at this point in time with this game, so that should not be a major issue. However, I have not experienced the full depth of this game at this point so that remains to be seen in its entirety.

As a last note, I must say that I consider this game to be amazing. The developer has definitely hit on a great idea for the basic gameplay, and with a little bit of polish and further development to add more features, this game will be at the top of my favorite games list in no time.

28475508.review:
I'm just going to give my honest review on the game. No witty, sarcastic comments.

(there's a tl;dr version at the bottom of the review.)

First off.
I love this game.
Albeit I suck at it, I love it.



Here's my pros and cons list.


Pros:
*Very fun, fast-paced, competitive gameplay.
*Tutorial tells you everything you need to know. Everything.
*It runs on the Unreal Engine (the same game engine Goat Simulator uses). Happy derpyass ragdolling time!
*Great with friends over LAN.
*7 maps to choose from.
*4 different gamemodes.
*5 different weapons that spawn in each map.
*The guy who made this is one of the most friendly devs I've ever seen. He responds to alot (if not all) of his comments and suggestions.
*This game updates SOOOOOOO frequently. Seriously. Just wow. I absolutely hope that this dev doesn't stop updating.
*This game truly has some potential in the long run.
*The dev is currently working on a Steam Workshop feature, which would allow people to make and upload new maps. Amazing. Absolutely amazing.

Cons:
*The biggest con is that it's hard to find open servers sometimes. This makes sense, as it's a relatively unknown early-access game. This can (and definitely will) be a real buzzkill though.
*All of the weapons spawn in the same place in each map. For instance, on the Pipe map, the rocket launcher always spawns in one room. This might sound nice to some people, but when you have some dipshit puppyguarding the sniper rifle, it's really annoying. This also gives more experienced players an advantage, as they probably know from the get-go where all of the weapons are in one map. You get swarmed by a guy with a rocket launcher before you even know how half of the map is laid out. I don't think they can fix this, but if you COULD randomize weapons spawn points, it would make the game just a tiny bit better.
*No singleplayer bots yet. (it's only multiplayer)




Did I mention the game is only 3 bucks? 
That is one of the best deals I've ever seen. (other than like when gmod is on sale and it's only like $2)





tl;dr version:

Terrific game at a reasonable price. The game itself has so much potential. A couple problems here and there, but amazing in the grand scheme of things. I absolutely can't wait to see how it progresses. The final version will be amazing.




Rating:
9.88888888/10

28230292.review:
This is an excellent game for the money you're paying,  and in-spite of the small development team, and the state it's in (early access). Here are some pros and cons I've seen in the little time I've played:

Pros
-Super great concept (reminiscent of the battle room from Ender's game)
-Incredibly cheap
-Controls are pretty intuitive
-Some nice variety in the guns
-Hillarious ragdoll physics

Cons
-Very few people on the servers (I have a friend who plays, so not a huge deal, but I'd like to see some growth)
-Pretty ugly user interface
-Not a ton of features (no local multiplayer, no LAN option, no AI in single player, etc.)

Keep in mind that a lot of the cons will be fixed as the game continues to go through development, and the creator has said he intends to fix a lot of the things I've mentioned. All in all, for three dollars (you spend more than that on fast food) this game is a steal. What are you waiting for?

-no absurd bonuses for killing your enemies

Cons
-The soundtrack is repetitive.
-next to nobody on any servers.
-No local multiplayer*.
-limited amount of maps, with no user map creating.
-the weapons are limited, with no real power differences between any of them.
-not a whole lot of character customization(which I could see as like a paid game-pass or dlc set)

*For all of you kids out there, Local Multiplayer is something that requires friends in the same room, and controlers of some kind. (note, with all local multiplayer games, friends are not included.)

Now, I can see that Zero G Arena is still in Early Access, Which is fine, and which is also why I reccomend this amazing game. $5.99 is an amazing deal for a fun game like this.

With Love,
Xerrif Shadeheart.

26483728.review:
I have always wanted a game where I could battle people in zero gravity. My biggest pet peeve with most space games is that there is always "artificial gravity" in the ships, so all the walking and such is just like any other shooter out there. This game is a major breath of fresh air in comparison. There is true zero gravity, you can attach yourself to surfaces in any direction. The only thing the game really needs is a bit of polishing.

Pros:
-Lack of gravity
-Great physics
-Mind-bending arenas
-Unique gameplay
-Low price, well worth the $3

Cons:
-textures are simplistic
-Sound effects need polishing
-UI could be refined
-No background music
-Few servers (if there are none open, just host your own and people will join, I hosted for a matter of seconds and almost immediately had people joining)

All in all, the game shows great potential. I really cannot wait to see how this one will turn out. I am definitely going to be spending more time in this game. 

 8/10 for gameplay, will increase as the game improves.

LOTS of fun even in it's current state. It still needs a lot of work but that's obvious because the game is still in Early Access. It's playable, just not a lot of content and players. I can only see 2 servers when finding a game. But it's still growing and soon it will get more players.

Right now it only has 3 game modes: Free for All, TDM and Capture the Sphere. CtS is like Capture the flag gamemodes in other games, but this time it's a sphere and you have to pull it with your gun to the goal. I like it, but it has balancing issues. Can be fixed by maybe adding a respawn timer and make the sphere move faster.
The game only has 6 maps and 5 guns right now, but they all vary.

Can't go wrong with this game, it still has a lot of room for improvement and it will be updated frequently.
If you want to try the game, see how gravity works in this game and whatnot, go for it! It takes time getting used to it, but it's really fun!

25461162.review:
Sehr gutes Spiel!

Zero G Areana ist ein arena shooter mit eininigen interessanten Elementetn.

1. Man kann nur auf bestimmten Flächen der Maps laufen, jedoch können diese sich auch an der Decke befinden

2. Mit der Taste "e" kann man die Schwerkraft ausschalten und fliegt unkontroliert durch den Raum.

3. Mit der Rechten Maustaste kann man einen Grappling Hook benutzen durch welchen man sich, falls man vorher die Schwerelosigkeit deaktiviert hat, geziehlt durch den Raum bewegen kann. Hierbei muss man darauf achten nicht zu viel Schwung zu nehmen, da man sonst gegen eine z.B. Wand knallt und somit Kontrollen verliert.

4. Die Waffen funktionieren gut, sind aber nicht außergewöhnlich.


Anfangs bewegt man sich noch relativ unbeholfen über die Map, jedoch kann man bereits nach ein bisschen Spielzeit elegant über die Map fliegen und Manöver ausführen um die Gegner zu verwirren.

24994739.review:
"call of duty infinite derpyness" thanks TheLemonGuy, that is the perfect term to describe this.

What is this?
Zero G Arena. There really isn´t much more to explain, mate.

What do you do in this game?
You kill other players in a small arena with no gravity.

How?
You have a few weapons to choose from to morph your enemies into compost. A SMG (the first gun you get), an auto-shotgun, a snipars, a rocket launcher with homing missiles (don´t worry it´s not OP) and a "Megarail" rail gun.

Wait, no gravity? How can I move then?
Because we are in the futor, everyone has magnet boots you can switch on and off and a grappling hook in case you want to believe you can fly or the magnet boots stopped working. You can also use the grappling hook to hook on other players. 

How can people recognize me as PewDiePie?
You can paint your suit I guess.
Idfk how you want to look like poods in a space suit but okay.

What game can I compare this to?
If you really want to know, imagine a weird ass hybrid of Quake 3 and Space Engineers.
You get the zero G from Space Engineers (duh!) and the insane and fast paced gameplay straight outta Quake, and bam you get this.

uuuuu, any downsides?
Depends on how you look at it.
The graphics are.... fairly mediocre. I don´t know how but the dev managed to make an Unreal Engine game look like Unity, at least on my mid-high settings. But the performance and optimization is pretty good.
And overall is the game really basic. I don´t mean generic, I mean basic like a lack of content.
But especially the latter is not worth getting butthurt over. The dev himself wrote in his Early Access thing for this game that he first wants to look, if people like the core gameplay and give constructive feedback. If this happens, then he will continue working on the game, adding content and ideas.
(This also is the reason why this game is free, so everyone can test it out)


I think this game has great potential, even in it´s early and very basic state at the moment it´s very damn fun to play. I couldn´t stop laughing for this half an hour I´ve played so far.
Of course, play it yourself to get a more detailed image of the game, it won´t hurt to download these 200 mb. And leave your feedback. pls.


Suggestions:
First person mode (maybe even VR)
Visual customizations on suit/playermodel and guns (notice how I said visual, by that I mean they shouldn´t change the gameplay at all)
Workshop (especially for maps)

24578843.review:
很有创意的一款第三人称射击游戏。

没有了真正意义上的上下，没有了重力。只有一双可以固定在特定墙面上的鞋子，按E切换是否开启鞋子的吸附。

当失去了重力，只能凭惯性和枪支的后坐力进行移动。可用通过这种移动方式获取地图上的一些更强有力的枪支。枪支似乎不能主动换弹，而且有子弹数量的限制（包括初始武器）。[spoiler] 所以我已经想象到多人游戏中一通瞎JB乱射没子弹后被追的屁滚尿流满图跑但是无可奈何的场景了
[/spoiler]

右键的电光相当于橡皮筋，初始长度等于你拉起来的长度，所以刚拉起来时并没有弹力……不是《叔叔的故事》里那种扯起来就能把你带过去的光束。所以怎么用是门技术活……[spoiler] 不知道能不能扯到敌人身上[/spoiler]

没有找到人一起进行游戏……只能自己在地图里瞎蹦跶。

有三点要吐槽：

地图没有了固定的上下，简直是路痴的噩梦。我这个连CSdust2地形都记不住的老菜鸟简直一脸懵逼。而且这游戏正如你在视频里看到的那样，地图里并没有标志性的建筑物……看起来哪儿跟哪儿都一个样……

准星太小了，浅绿色的准星混在白色为主的地图里根本看不到……

为何每次失重在空中都要咧开腿啊……





总体来说，很期待这款游戏后续的更新和完善。
